quiz_description: Understand your organisation's readiness for AI adoption

creative.name: Creative & Cultural
creative.description: Arts, design, media, and creative industries

retail.name: Retail & E-commerce
retail.description: Shops, online stores, and consumer goods

professional.name: Professional Services
professional.description: Consulting, accounting, legal, and business services

technology.name: Technology & Software
technology.description: IT services, software development, and tech products

education.name: Education & Training
education.description: Schools, training providers, and educational services

republic_ireland.name: Republic of Ireland
republic_ireland.description: Based in the Republic of Ireland

questions.text: Which sector best describes your organisation?
questions.description: This helps us provide sector-specific insights and recommendations.
This helps us provide region-specific funding and support information.

questions.text: How well defined are your organisation's digital transformation goals?

options.text: We have no formal digital strategy
We have discussed digital goals but nothing documented
We have documented digital goals but no clear implementation plan
We have clear, documented digital goals with implementation roadmaps

questions.text: How would you describe your organisation's approach to data management?

options.text: We store data but don't actively manage or analyse it
We track key metrics but data is scattered across systems
We have centralised data storage and regular reporting
We have robust data governance and analytics capabilities

questions.text: What is your team's current level of AI and digital tool literacy?

options.text: Limited - most staff use only basic digital tools
Moderate - some staff are comfortable with digital tools
Good - most staff regularly use digital tools and are open to learning
Advanced - team actively explores and adopts new technologies

questions.text: How would you rate your current technology infrastructure?

options.text: Outdated systems with frequent issues
Basic systems that meet current needs but limited scalability
Modern systems with cloud services and regular updates
Cutting-edge infrastructure with APIs and integration capabilities

questions.text: How does your organisation approach innovation and change?

options.text: We prefer to stick with proven methods
We're cautious but will adopt when others have proven success
We actively seek opportunities to improve processes
We have a culture of experimentation and continuous improvement

questions.text: What resources can your organisation commit to AI initiatives?

options.text: Very limited - we're focused on day-to-day operations
Some capacity - we could allocate a few hours per week
Moderate capacity - we have budget and time for pilot projects
Strong capacity - we have dedicated resources for innovation

questions.text: How documented and standardised are your key business processes?

options.text: Most processes are informal and undocumented
Key processes are understood but not formally documented
Most processes are documented with some standardisation
Comprehensive process documentation with continuous improvement

questions.text: How familiar is your leadership team with AI capabilities and use cases?

options.text: Limited awareness - AI seems complex and distant
Basic awareness - we've heard about AI but unclear on applications
Good awareness - we understand potential use cases for our sector
Strong awareness - we're actively exploring specific AI opportunities

strategy.name: Strategic Planning
strategy.description: Clear vision and goals for digital transformation
strategy.explanation: Strategic planning measures whether your organisation has articulated goals for digital transformation and AI adoption. Organisations with strong strategic foundations can align AI initiatives with business objectives, secure leadership buy-in, and measure ROI effectively.

data.name: Data Readiness
data.description: Ability to collect, manage and analyse data effectively
data.explanation: Data is the fuel for AI systems. This dimension assesses your organisation's maturity in collecting, storing, and leveraging data. Strong data practices enable better AI outcomes and reduce implementation risks.

skills.name: Team Capabilities
skills.description: Staff skills and willingness to adopt new technologies
skills.explanation: Your team's digital literacy and openness to learning directly impacts AI adoption success. Organisations with stronger digital capabilities can implement AI tools faster and maximise their value.

infrastructure.name: Technical Infrastructure
infrastructure.description: Quality and scalability of existing technology systems
infrastructure.explanation: Modern, scalable infrastructure supports AI integration and experimentation. Legacy systems may require upgrades or workarounds before AI tools can be effectively deployed.

culture.name: Organisational Culture
culture.explanation: A culture that embraces experimentation and continuous improvement accelerates AI adoption. Organisations that resist change face longer implementation timelines and lower success rates.

resources.name: Resource Availability
resources.description: Time, budget and commitment for AI initiatives
resources.explanation: Successful AI adoption requires dedicated time and budget. Organisations that can allocate resources to experimentation and learning see faster results than those constrained by day-to-day operations.

processes.name: Process Maturity
processes.explanation: Well-documented processes are easier to optimise with AI. Understanding your current workflows helps identify where AI can add value and enables better measurement of improvements.

awareness.name: AI Awareness
awareness.description: Understanding of AI capabilities and opportunities
awareness.explanation: Leadership understanding of AI capabilities shapes realistic expectations and informed decision-making. Higher awareness correlates with more strategic AI investments and better outcomes.

score_bands.summary: Your organisation is in the early stages of digital readiness. Focus on building foundational capabilities before pursuing AI initiatives.
recommendations: Start with basic digital literacy training for your team
Identify one or two areas where better data tracking could help
Attend introductory workshops on AI for business
score_bands.next_steps: Consider our Foundation Workshop package to help your team understand AI basics and identify quick wins.
score_bands.state_of_industry: AI adoption is accelerating across all sectors, but successful implementation requires solid digital foundations. Organisations at your maturity level should focus on strengthening core capabilities rather than rushing into AI deployment. The good news: simple, affordable AI tools are increasingly accessible for businesses building their digital capabilities.

sector_uptake.manufacturing: In manufacturing, AI adoption ranges from basic inventory management systems to sophisticated predictive maintenance. At your maturity level, focus on digitising manual processes and establishing reliable data collection before considering AI applications.
sector_uptake.creative: Creative sectors are seeing rapid AI adoption in content generation and design assistance. However, successful use requires understanding your creative processes and where AI can augment rather than replace human creativity.
sector_uptake.food: Food businesses are using AI for inventory optimisation, demand forecasting, and customer preferences. Start by digitising your ordering and stock management systems to create the data foundation AI needs.
sector_uptake.default: Across all sectors, successful AI adoption begins with strong digital foundations. Organisations at your level should focus on basic digitisation and data practices before pursuing AI implementations.

score_bands.future_developments: Over the next 12-18 months, focus on building digital literacy across your team, documenting core processes, and establishing basic data management practices. These foundations will position you for AI experimentation when you're ready. Expect AI tools to become more accessible and user-friendly, making entry easier for SMEs.

common_tools.name: ChatGPT / Claude
common_tools.description: AI assistants for writing, brainstorming, and content creation. Useful for drafting emails, marketing copy, and exploring ideas.
common_tools.notes: Start here. These tools require no technical setup and provide immediate value for content tasks. Focus on learning effective prompting techniques.

common_tools.name: Canva AI
common_tools.description: Design platform with AI-powered image generation, background removal, and layout suggestions.
common_tools.notes: Great for businesses needing marketing materials without a dedicated designer. AI features help non-designers create professional content.

common_tools.name: Grammarly
common_tools.description: AI-powered writing assistant for grammar, tone, and clarity improvements.
common_tools.notes: Improves written communication quality across your organisation. Particularly valuable for customer-facing content.

common_tools.name: Google Workspace AI
common_tools.description: AI features in Gmail, Docs, and Sheets for drafting, summarising, and data analysis.
common_tools.notes: If you already use Google Workspace, these AI features are available at no extra cost. Start experimenting with Smart Compose and Help me write.

items: **Invest NI Innovation Vouchers** - Up to ¬£5,000 for innovation projects including AI exploration. No match funding required for businesses under 50 employees.
**Digital Skills Support** - Funding available through local councils for digital upskilling programmes.
**Enterprise NI SME Support** - Various programmes offering support for digital transformation, including subsidised consultancy.
**Scottish Enterprise Digital Boost** - Grants and support for digital transformation projects.
**Skills Development Scotland** - Funding for workforce digital upskilling.
**Scottish Government Innovation Support** - Various schemes supporting business innovation.
**Innovate UK SMART Grants** - Funding for innovative technology projects.
**Local Enterprise Partnerships** - Regional support for business growth and innovation.
**Help to Grow: Digital** - Government scheme supporting SME digital adoption.
**Business Wales Innovation Vouchers** - Support for exploring new technologies.
**Welsh Government Smart Cymru** - R&D funding for innovation projects.
**Digital Development Fund** - Grants for digital technology adoption.
**Enterprise Ireland Innovation Vouchers** - Up to ‚Ç¨5,000 for innovation projects.
**Local Enterprise Office Support** - Training and grant support for SMEs.
**Skillnet Ireland** - Subsidised training programmes including digital skills.

general: Look for sector-specific innovation programmes through your local enterprise agency
Council-commissioned digital skills programmes often include AI awareness training
Consider peer learning groups or business networks for shared learning opportunities

actions: Assign one team member as digital champion to explore AI tools
Sign up for free trials of ChatGPT Plus and Canva Pro
Identify three repetitive tasks that could benefit from automation or AI assistance
Attend a Flax & Teal introductory workshop on AI for business
Document your top 5-10 business processes
Start collecting basic data on customer interactions and sales patterns
Run small experiments with free AI tools in marketing or customer service
Schedule time for team members to learn about AI through online resources
Review your experiments and identify which AI tools added value
Develop a simple digital roadmap identifying areas for improvement
Consider investing in a paid AI tool that showed clear benefits
Explore Invest NI innovation vouchers for external AI consultancy

common_strategies.description: Have team members use AI tools for their individual tasks (emails, research, content) before attempting organisation-wide implementation. This builds familiarity and identifies champions.
Content creation is where AI delivers quick wins for SMEs. Use AI to draft social media posts, product descriptions, email campaigns, and basic graphics.
As you experiment with AI tools, document what works and what doesn't. This creates organisational learning and prevents repeated mistakes.
Connect with other SMEs exploring AI through council programmes, enterprise agencies, or Flax & Teal workshops. Peer learning accelerates adoption and reduces isolated frustration.

contact_cta.heading: Ready to Build Your AI Foundation?
contact_cta.message: Our Foundation Workshop helps SMEs at your stage understand AI capabilities and identify practical starting points. We provide hands-on training and personalised guidance to build your confidence.

score_bands.summary: Your organisation has some digital capabilities in place but needs strengthening before scaling AI adoption.
recommendations: Improve data collection and management practices
Pilot small AI tools for specific use cases (e.g., content generation)
Build a clearer digital transformation roadmap
Invest in upskilling key team members
score_bands.next_steps: Our Tier 1 Workshop and Mentoring package could help you run focused pilots and build momentum.
score_bands.state_of_industry: You're in a strong position relative to many SMEs. Organisations at your maturity level are successfully running AI pilots and beginning to integrate AI into standard workflows. The key challenge is moving from experimentation to systematic adoption.

sector_uptake.default: Across sectors, organisations at your level are piloting AI in 2-3 specific use cases. Focus on learning from these experiments and gradually expanding successful applications rather than pursuing multiple simultaneous initiatives.

score_bands.future_developments: Over the next 6-12 months, consolidate your digital infrastructure and data practices. Successful pilots should be scaled, unsuccessful ones discontinued. Build internal expertise through training and mentoring. Expect to see measurable productivity gains in the areas where you've deployed AI effectively.

common_tools.name: Notion AI / Craft
common_tools.description: AI-enhanced workspace for documentation, project management, and knowledge sharing with automatic summarisation and content generation.
common_tools.notes: Helps centralise information and make it accessible. AI features assist with documentation and knowledge retrieval.

common_tools.name: HubSpot AI / Mailchimp AI
common_tools.description: CRM and marketing platforms with AI for email optimisation, content suggestions, and customer segmentation.
common_tools.notes: Suitable for businesses ready to systematise marketing. AI helps optimise campaigns and personalise customer communications.

common_tools.name: Zapier with AI
common_tools.description: Connects different software tools with AI-powered automation for repetitive tasks.
common_tools.notes: Powerful for automating workflows between systems. Requires some technical comfort but no coding skills.

actions: Audit current AI tool usage across your organisation
Identify 2-3 high-impact pilot projects
Designate AI champions within key departments
Book a Tier 1 workshop with mentoring support

common_strategies.description: Run focused pilots in specific areas, measure results rigorously, then scale successes. Don't spread resources too thin.

contact_cta.heading: Ready to Scale Your AI Pilots?
contact_cta.message: Our Tier 1 Workshop and Mentoring package helps organisations like yours move from experimentation to systematic adoption with hands-on support.

score_bands.summary: Your organisation has good foundations and is ready to actively experiment with AI tools and approaches.
recommendations: Launch pilot AI projects in 2-3 areas (e.g., marketing, operations)
Establish clear success metrics for AI initiatives
Build internal champions who can support broader adoption
Consider how AI can support your strategic goals
score_bands.next_steps: Our Tier 2 Full Engagement package provides hands-on support plus insights to guide your AI strategy.
score_bands.state_of_industry: Organisations at your maturity level are integrating AI into core workflows and seeing measurable productivity gains. The focus shifts from experimentation to scaling successful implementations and building organisational AI capability.

sector_uptake.default: Developing-level organisations are moving beyond pilots to systematic AI deployment. Success requires balancing ambition with pragmatism - scale what works, iterate on what doesn't, and build the internal capability to sustain progress.

score_bands.future_developments: Over the next 6-12 months, focus on scaling successful pilots, building internal expertise, and establishing governance frameworks. Expect to see compound benefits as AI tools integrate with each other and your workflows. Leadership understanding and organisational change management become critical success factors.

common_tools.name: Custom GPT / Claude Projects
common_tools.description: Create customised AI assistants trained on your specific processes, data, and needs.
common_tools.notes: Powerful for creating organisation-specific AI capabilities without custom development. Requires clear understanding of use cases and good prompt engineering.

common_tools.name: Make.com / n8n
common_tools.description: Visual automation platforms with AI integrations for complex workflows.
common_tools.notes: More powerful than Zapier for complex scenarios. Requires technical comfort but enables sophisticated AI-powered workflows.

actions: Map current AI usage and identify scaling opportunities
Establish KPIs for AI initiatives
Create an AI governance framework
Book Tier 2 Full Engagement workshop

common_strategies.description: Identify and empower AI champions across departments who can drive adoption, support colleagues, and provide feedback on what's working.

contact_cta.heading: Ready to Scale Systematically?
contact_cta.message: Our Tier 2 Full Engagement package provides hands-on support and strategic insights to help you move from pilots to systematic AI integration.

score_bands.summary: Your organisation is well-positioned for AI adoption and can pursue ambitious initiatives with confidence.
recommendations: Develop a comprehensive AI adoption roadmap across functions
Invest in advanced AI capabilities (custom models, automation)
Share your learnings to position as an innovation leader
score_bands.next_steps: Our Tier 3 Programme Pilot can help you develop a sector-leading AI capability and document your approach.
score_bands.state_of_industry: You're among the leading SMEs in AI maturity. Organisations at your level are differentiating competitively through AI, developing proprietary capabilities, and often advising peers. The opportunity is to leverage this advantage strategically and avoid common scaling pitfalls.

sector_uptake.default: Advanced organisations are pushing the boundaries of what's possible for SMEs with AI. Success requires balancing innovation with operational stability, building versus buying capabilities, and managing the organisational change that comes with AI-driven transformation.

score_bands.future_developments: Focus on building sustainable competitive advantage through AI, developing sector-specific expertise, and potentially creating IP or proprietary capabilities. Consider how AI enables new business models or market opportunities. Governance, ethics, and responsible AI become increasingly important.

common_tools.name: OpenAI API / Anthropic API
common_tools.description: Direct API access to advanced AI models for building custom applications.
common_tools.notes: Enables building proprietary AI capabilities integrated with your systems. Requires technical expertise or development partners like Flax & Teal.

common_tools.name: Retool / Internal Tools
common_tools.description: Build internal applications with AI capabilities tailored to your workflows.
common_tools.notes: For organisations ready to build custom tooling. Combines database access, APIs, and AI in purpose-built applications.

common_strategies.description: Move beyond off-the-shelf tools to develop AI capabilities that create competitive advantage. This might include custom models, unique data sets, or proprietary workflows.
Share your AI journey through case studies, speaking, and peer support. This builds reputation, attracts talent, and creates business development opportunities.
